alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 11:42AM CST until March 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville affecting Pemiscot, New Madrid and Lake Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...From this morning to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, In Tennessee, a large section of Lake County Tennessee Road 79 is flooded near the levee. Most fields and pastures south of Stewart, Missouri, are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 32.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.5 feet Friday morning. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
